column7: Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Pastoralists (Central African Republic)
column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column9: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 18 May 2020, Fulani armed rebels of the UPC clashed with the Military Forces with the support of MINUSCA in Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou), in another attempt to regain control of the town. The rebels were repelled by the army. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 20 May 2020, Christian community members looted and destroyed property belonging to Muslim community members in Obo (Haut-Mbomou), prompting many Muslims to flee towards Mboki town. No reason was reported. [size=no report]

On 20 May 2020, 1 NGO driver was reportedly ambushed and beaten by 7 armed Fulani militiamen near a village 90 km east of Bouar (Nana-Mambere). The perpetrators stole cash, documents and other personal items. The driver was admitted at the Bouar hospital.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column9: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 20 May 2020, Fulani armed rebels of the UPC clashed with the Military Forces with the support of MINUSCA in Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou) in another attempt of the rebels to regain control of the town. The rebels were repelled by the army, who killed around 10 assailants and captured others.

On 22 May 2020, 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) rebels assaulted and tortured 1 man in Niem (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). The victim died of his injuries days after in the hospital. The motive behind the assault is not known.
On 24 May 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men abducted a man who had raped a young girl in Irabanda (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The man was released after paying money to the armed group.

On 24 May 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men abducted an elderly woman accused of witchcraft in Mbeti village, 36 km south of Irabanda (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The woman was released following the intervention of civil society members.

Around 24 May 2020 (week of), Anti-Balaka armed farmers clashed with Fulani herders from Chad near Bouca (Bouca, Ouham). The Anti-Balaka abducted 3 local Fulani children who were accompanying the herders. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column7: Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Pastoralists (Central African Republic)
column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column9: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 25 May 2020, the Fulani armed rebels of the UPC clashed with the Military Forces, supported by MINUSCA, in Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou), in another attempt to regain control of the town. The rebels were repelled by the army, who recovered some weapons. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 25 May 2020, Fulani Ethnic militiamen abducted 6 staff including 3 women of the Danish Refugee Council (DRC) INGO in Batangafo (Batangafo, Ouham). The kidnappers demanded the release of 3 Fulani children who had been held hostage the week before by Antibalaka armed men.

On 27 May 2020, hundreds of demobilized ex-combatants gathered and demonstrated in Bouar town (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). The demonstrators, beneficiaries of a UN's reinsertion project, demanded their training certificates and social kits, put on hold since to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=hundreds]

On 27 May 2020, around 100 rebels of the 3R armed group occupied the village of Koundjili (Paoua, Ouham Pende). The rebels, who stormed the village firing into the air, intimidated the local population forcing many of them to flee towards the forest for safety. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 31 May 2020, ex-Seleka (UPC) rebels assaulted and robbed a man traveling on a motorcycle in Kitessa (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 1 June 2020, former Seleka UPC forces occupied Tchokofro village, 10 km from Ira banda (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The armed men fired shots into the air and raised a UPC flag, prompting local civilians to flee into the bush.
On 2 June 2020, a mob of local vigilantes beat a man who robbed a woman in Bria (Haute-Kotto). The assailant was seriously injured and transferred to the hospital. [size=no report]

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 2 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men abducted 1 man in Bria (Haute-Kotto) after his phone number was discovered in the phone of the wife of a combatant. The civil society negotiated and the man was released.

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 4 June 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men attempted to loot goods during an NGO distribution in Bria (Haute-Kotto), but MINUSCA forces intervened (assumed clash) and the assailants left. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 4 June 2020, rebels from an unknown ex-Seleka militia abducted a truck driver and his apprentice in Ippy (Ippy, Ouaka) and then demanded a ransom for their release.
On 5 June 2020, Anti-balaka armed men abducted a man in Tchokofro village, 10 km from Ira banda (Bria, Haute-Kotto), after the man assaulted his wife.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 5 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) militiamen temporarily abducted a girl in Bria (Haute-Kotto) because her husband told the rebels that she had spent the night at another person's house. Civil society intervened to secure the girl's release after paying money.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column8: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 5 June 2020, Military Forces with the support of MINUSCA peacekeepers clashed with 5 armed rebels of the FPRC armed group in Miammani village, near Ndele (Ndele, Bamingui-Bangoran). The rebels were quickly disarmed by the military forces and then arrested.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 6 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) militiamen abducted a boy in Bria (Haute-Kotto). The victim was released after the payment of a ransom. Civil society leaders intervened to reduce the amount money demanded by this armed group.

On 7 June 2020, a group of armed men from the 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) blocked a road and robbed 3 vehicles belonging to aid workers and the phones of of dozens of travelers in Dongbake village, located 10 Km from Baboua (Baboua, Nana-Mambere). Reportedly, MINUSCA forces were present but did not intervene. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 7 June 2020, an FPRC combatant shot and injured a civilian man with an intellectual disability in Ouadda (Haute-Kotto). The civil society members took the injured man to Bria for treatment. The motive of the attack was not reported.

column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 8 June 2020, a group of young people marched in the streets of Kaga-Bandoro (Kaga-Bandoro, Nana-Grebizi) and then looted the residence of the local government chief following the release of MPC armed men by the local authorities and the MINUSCA the same day. The FOCA military forces arrived when the assailants had already gone. The demonstrators accused the local authorities of complicity with these rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 8 June 2020, militiamen of the MPC (Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic) clashed with MINUSCA peacekeepers when these militiamen were robbing a NRC humanitarian vehicle in Kaga-Bandoro (Kaga-Bandoro, Nana-Grebizi). The MINUSCA managed to arrest some of the militiamen, including one of the leaders. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column16: AFP; AP; Africa 1; BBC News; Reuters
column17: On 8 June 2020, the Sudanese former leader of the Janjaweed militia in Darfur, Ali Kushayb, was arrested by Central African Republic authorities in Birao (Birao, Vakaga), close to the border with Sudan. Kushayb, who is charged with 50 crimes against humanity and war crimes by the International Criminal Court (ICC), voluntarily handed himself over 13 years after an international warrant was issued for him. He was then transferred to an ICC's detention center in The Hague (The Netherlands).

On 8 June 2020, 5 armed men from an unknown ex-Seleka militia clashed with an armed Sara ethnic man in Boungou (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto). The ex-Seleka shot the man dead and looted Fulani people while leaving.

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 9 June 2020, 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen clashed with MINUSCA peacekeepers during an incursion of these rebels against a UN military base in Pougol, 30 Km from Paoua (Paoua, Ouham Pende). The rebels left 2 peacekeepers with minor injuries and 4 others disarmed before leaving.

column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2019-) Special Mixed Security Units
column9: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-); MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column16: Corbeau News; Radio Ndeke Luka; Africa 1; aBangui
column17: On 9 June 2020, a group of 3R armed men carrying heavy weapons clashed with military soldiers of the Special Mixed Security Units (USMS) during an assault of these rebels against a USMS training military base in Wantiguira village, 8 Km from Bouar (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). The rebels seized weapons and ammunitions. FACA and MINUSCA reinforcements arrived and managed to drive back the rebels, killing at least 5 and recovering part of the weaponry stolen. At least 17 soldiers were injured and 2 rebels were arrested.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column7: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic; Former Seleka Militia
column17: On 9 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC and UPC) rebels abducted 1 boy after he was accused of raping a girl in Bria (Haute-Kotto).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 10 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men beat 1 man in Boulouba, 12 km from Yangoudroundja (Bria, Haute-Kotto), because he had an affair with the wife of an Ex-Seleka . The victim was abducted and held pending the payment of 300,000 CF for his release.

On 12 June 2020, 3R armed men abducted 2 civilians in Yamassore village, 46 Km from Bozoum (Bozoum, Ouham Pende), and then asked for a ransom for their release. Reportedly, dozens of 3R armed men had established in this village since the previous week, triggering tensions in Bozoum town, where local self-defenses militias were being created fearing an eventual incursion.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column17: On 14 June 2020, 1 Ex-Seleka (MPC) combatant looted a motorcycle from a motor-taxi driver in Bria (Haute-Kotto).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 16 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) militiamen abducted 5 civilians in Zemio (Haut-Mbomou) when the victims were going to a training related to the upcoming elections. Community leaders negotiated with the armed group to secure their release.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 17 June 2020, a coalition of Central African Military forces and MINUSCA troops clashed with 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen in the Nana-Mambere region, in the context of a military operation to neutralize the territorial expansion of the militia. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 17 June 2020, a coalition of Central African Military forces and MINUSCA troops clashed with 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen in the Ouham Pende region, in the context of a military operation to neutralize the territorial expansion of the militia. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 17 June 2020, the leader of the ex-Seleka (UPC), Ali Drassa, signed an agreement in Ndele (Bamingui-Bangoran) to merge forces and operate as allies with Sidiki Abbas, the leader of 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) armed group.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 17 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) abducted 1 Fulani man and his wife in Ippy (Ouaka), following a domestic dispute. The wife was released that day while the husband continued to be held by the armed group, who demanded a ransom of 300,000 CF for his release.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 17 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) armed men abducted 1 priest in Mboki (Haut-Mbomou, Obo), preventing him from delivering census data related to the upcoming elections. The priest was released after payment to the armed group.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 18 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men abducted 1 vendor in Bria (Haute-Kotto) because he refused to pay them a tax. The civil society secured the victim's release.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column9: WFP: World Food Programme; Aid Workers (Central African Republic)
column17: On 19 June 2020, Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic (MPC) fighters, led by Mahamat Al-Khatim, kidnapped 1 UN World Food Programme employee in Kaga-Bandoro (Nana-Grebizi), when the victim was driving a food truck towards Ndele.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 19 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) elements abducted a local chief in Boulouba, 12 km from Yangoudroundja (Bria, Haute-Kotto). Other local chiefs negotiated with the armed group to secure the release of the detainee for a reduced ransom.

On 21 June 2020, Anti-Balaka elements abducted 2 siblings (a man and a woman) 21 km west of Bria (Haute-Kotto). The victims were accused of collaborating with state security forces. They both were released after a payment.

column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column9: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Gendarmerie; MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 22 June 2020, militiamen of the 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) clashed with a convoy of military soldiers, gendarmes and MINUSCA Forces in an ambush near Besson (Babua, Nana-Mambere). The ambush resulted in 5 soldiers killed, including a gendarme, and 10 injured. Six other soldiers went missing. The incident took place during the course of military operations against this militia.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column8: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 22 June 2020, the FPRC started the disarmament and demobilization process in Ndele (Bamingui-Bangoran), where more than 80 combatants handed over 41 weapons, including mortars, machine guns and anti-tank weapons. The process was part of a peace and demobilization agreement signed with the government authorities in 2018.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Adam Faction)
column17: On 22 June 2020, presumed cadres of the FPRC, led by Noureddine Adan, broke into the headquarters of the INGO Warchildren in Ndele (Bamingui-Bangoran) and looted computers and office material. On the same day, this armed group started its disarmament and demobilization process in this town.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 22 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) armed men abducted a man accused of having an affair in Ippy (Ouaka). The man had to pay 300,000 CF for his release.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 23 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men beat a woman who they had abducted in Bria (Haute-Kotto). The woman had been abducted with another woman because they had had a quarrel with each other. They were released the same day.
On 23 June 2020, a vigilante mob beat 1 prisoner who attempted to escape in Koumboli (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou). A local leader intervened and turned the prisoner over to the MINUSCA. [size=no report]

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 23 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) armed men abducted a man in Koumboli village (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou). The victim, the chief of this village, was accused of supporting a mob attack. Local leaders intervened and secured his release.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column7: Former Seleka Militia; Private Security Forces (Chad)
column17: Around 25 June 2020 (as reported), militia combatants of the Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic (MPC), led by Mahamat Al-Khatim, with the support of mercenaries from Chad occupied Boguila locality (Nangha Boguila, Ouham). The occupation took place after the retreat of the military forces and the MINUSCA from the area in the last months. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column7: Former Seleka Militia; Private Security Forces (Chad)
column17: Around 25 June 2020 (as reported), combatants from the Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic (MPC), led by Mahamat Al-Khatim, with the support of mercenaries from Chad occupied Nana-Bakassa locality (Nana-Bakassa, Ouham). The occupation took place after the retreat of the military forces and the MINUSCA from the area in the last months. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column7: Former Seleka Militia; Private Security Forces (Chad)
column17: Around 25 June 2020 (as reported), militia combatants of the Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic (MPC), led by Mahamat Al-Khatim, with the support of mercenaries from Chad occupied Beboura 3 locality (Paoua, Ouham). The occupation took place after the retreat of the military forces and the MINUSCA from the area in the last months. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
column7: Former Seleka Militia; Private Security Forces (Chad)
column17: Around 25 June 2020 (as reported), militia combatants of the Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic (MPC), led by Mahamat Al-Khatim, with the support of mercenaries from Chad occupied the Kouki locality (Nana-Bakassa, Ouham), a mining area. The occupation took place after the retreat of military forces and the MINUSCA from the area in the last months. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 25 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) militiamen abducted a man and a woman in Ippy (Ouaka). The assailants demanded a ransom of 300,000 CF for their release. Civil society negotiated their release for a lowered amount.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: Around 26 June 2020 (as reported), the UPC militia erected illegal barriers in Bambouti (Haut-Mbomou), under control of this militia, where local civilians were forced to pay taxes and were subjected to harassment.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: Around 26 June 2020 (as reported), the UPC militia erected illegal barriers in Zemio (Haut-Mbomou), under control of this militia, where local civilians were forced to pay taxes and were subjected to harassment.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: Around 26 June 2020 (as reported), the UPC militia erected illegal barriers in Mboki (Haut-Mbomou), under control of this militia, where local civilians were forced to pay taxes and were subjected to harassment.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column7: Former Seleka Militia; Goula Ethnic Militia (Central African Republic)
column17: On 27 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) Goula militiamen assaulted several civilians, looted goods and fired shots into the air in Ouadda (Haute-Kotto). Much of the population fled into the bush. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 28 June 2020, a group took to the streets in Besson (Baboua, Nana-Mambere) to demand peace. [size=no report]

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column16: Corbeau News; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Ndeke Luka
column17: On 29 June 2020, during a two day battle, members of the 3R clashed with Bangladeshi MINUSCA soldiers at a checkpoint near Bocaranga (Bocaranga, Ouham Pende). A MINUSCA soldier was injured, and members of the 3R were killed. According to rumours, the leader of the group was killed, but such was denied by the group. Fatalities coded as 3 and split across two events.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 29 June 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men abducted a man in Aigbando (Bria, Haute-Kotto) after he was caught stealing from a field. Civil society leaders negotiated the man's release later that day.

On 30 June 2020, hundreds of candidates for election enumerator positions took to the streets in Ouham (Batangafo, Ouham), in a demonstration against irregularities in the recruitment process in the Bem-zembe commune. [size=hundreds]

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column16: Corbeau News; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Ndeke Luka
column17: On 30 June 2020, during a two day battle, members of the 3R clashed with Bangladeshi MINUSCA soldiers at a checkpoint near Bocaranga (Bocaranga, Ouham Pende). A MINUSCA soldier was injured, and members of the 3R were killed. According to rumours, the leader of the group was killed, but such was denied by the group. Fatalities coded as 3 and split across two events.

column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 2 July 2020, members of the 3R clashed with the Central African Armed Forces in Bocaranga (Bacaranga, Ouham Pete). Civilians were injured and a house was set on fire. It was believed the attack was a retaliation to a clash between the group and MINUSCA on 29 July 2020

column8: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: Around 2 July 2020 (between 2 - 3 July), members of the 3R clashed with and killed a police officer upon invading the city of Bozoum (Bozoum, Ouham Pende).
On 3 July 2020, members of the 3R robbed 4 imported motorcycles in Ndjim (Bocara, Ouhan Pende). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 3 July 2020, ex-Seleka FPRC forces abducted 3 young men in Bria (Haute-Kotto). The victims were accused of stealing.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 6 July 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) combatants tortured 1 man in Bakouma (Bakouma, Mbomou) because he had defected this armed group. Travelers discovered the injured young man and took him to the hospital.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column7: Private Security Forces (Chad); Fulani Ethnic Militia (Central African Republic)
column17: Around 6 July 2020 (between 3 - 10 July), 100 Chadian mercenaries joined the FPRC (Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa) in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The mercenaries joined Aba-Tom, the new Chadian commander of this Fulani armed group in control of Haute-Kotto province.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 7 July 2020, ex-Seleka FPRC forces intercepted a chartered NGO vehicle and abducted a group of aid workers in Bria (Haute-Kotto). NGO representatives negotiated the release of the victims.

On 7 July 2020, hundreds of young people marched and gathered in front of the National Assembly in Bangui, against the alleged parliamentary corruption in the voting of a new bill that would compromise the independence of the National Elections Authority (ANE). [size=hundreds]

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 7 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC combatants tortured 2 pastoralists who they had previously abducted in Loa village, at 17 km from Ippy (Ouaka). The attack occurred after the victims demanded money owed to them by a leader of this armed group.

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 8 July 2020, suspected 3R militia rebels used an IED against a patrolling MINUSCA armored vehicle on the Baoua-Besson road, near Besson (Nana-Mambere). The vehicle suffered some damage but no fatalities and/or injuries were reported.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 8 July 2020, Ex-Seleka (FPRC) forces shot and killed 1 miner in the mining locality of Kono (Bangassou, Mbomou). They killed the miner for wearing a voodoo amulet which the assailants associated with the Anti Balaka.

column6: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 8 July 2020, the police shot and killed an Anti-Balaka combatant in Bagandou (Mbaiki, Lobaye) as he tried to escape after having been arrested.

column8: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 8 July 2020, a group of locals vandalized, looted and set the police station ablaze in Bagandou (Mbaiki, Lobaye) in reaction to the killing of an Anti-Balaka combatant by police the same day. [size=no report]

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 10 July 2020, 3 ex-Seleka (UPC) combatants shot and killed 2 boys in an area 15 km from Gbassigbiri (Bambouti, Haut-Mbomou). The boys, who were also looted, were travelling with cartons of cigarettes.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 10 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC militiamen detained and extorted 1 man in Zemio village (Haut-Mbomou).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 11 July 2020, FPRC armed men abducted a woman because she refused to pay them at a check-point in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The woman was held for several hours before being released.

column8: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 13 July 2020, 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) armed men killed a Rwandan MINUSCA peacekeeper and injured 2 others during an ambush on a UN patrol in Gedze village in Nana-Mambere province.

On 14 July 2020, 3R militia combatants blocked the Bouar-Niem main road, near Bouar (Nana-Mambere), to prevent civilians from registering to vote in the next election, scheduled for December 2020. Reportedly, this militia had launched an operation to prevent citizens from registering in many localities of Nana-Mambere and Ouham-Pende provinces in order to increase their influence in the electoral process.

column8: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 15 July 2020, around 200 agents in charge of registering the population for voting in the next election blocked the streets and gathered in front of the National Election Authority (ANE) in Bangui to demand that they be deployed in the field to start working. The police intervened and dispersed the demonstrators. [size=around 200]

column9: Labour Group (Central African Republic); Aid Workers (Central African Republic)
column17: On 15 July 2020, 3R militia combatants looted more than 40 traders and aid workers after blocking the main road in Ngbama village (Ngaoundaye, Ouham Pende). The assailants robbed more than 50 million CFA and other goods from the victims.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 15 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC combatants temporarily abducted a local pastoralist leader in Bria (Haute-Kotto). The man was released after 3 hours.

On 16 July 2020, around 200 voter registration agents, recently trained for this job, blocked the streets and gathered in front of the National Election Authority (ANE) in Bangui to demand that they be deployed in the field to start working. They also accused the ANE of promoting nepotism and corruption during recruiting. [size=around 200]
On 16 July 2020, Anti-balaka combatants beat a motor-taxi driver in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The motive behind the attack was not reported.
On 16 July 2020, 3R militiamen shot and killed 5 people from the same family in Loura village, 20 Km from Bocaranga (Ouham Pende). The motive behind the attack was not reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 17 July 2020, UPC combatants abducted 1 man in Ippy (Ippy, Ouaka) because he had assaulted 1 woman. The man was released after paying a fine to the armed group.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 17 July 2020, a group of 5 ex-Seleka (FPRC) assailants tortured a civilian man in Sam-Ouandja (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto). Local residents fired shots in the air in attempt to dissuade further violence. Later on, FPRC leaders detained the 5 combatants.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 18 July 2020, UPC combatants beat and held captive 1 FOCA solider in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). He was accused of having an affair with a combatant's wife. Local residents intervened to secure the release of the solider.

column6: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 18 July 2020, MINUSCA troops (Tanzanian battalion) clashed with 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen in Gbambia (Amada-Gaza, Mambere-Kadei), following a military operation by the UN troops. The rebels were driven out from the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 19 July 2020, an unidentified armed group ambushed and killed 4 travellers (3 men and 1 woman) from the Sara ethnic group 50 km north of Yangoudroundja (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The victims were believed to have been targeted based on their ethnicity.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 20 July 2020, Ex-Seleka (UPC) armed men abducted and tortured 1 refugee in Mboki (Obo, Haut-Mbomou) because the man had attacked a woman.
On 21 July 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men looted 1 Fulani family in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: Around 21 July 2020 (as reported), Ex-Seleka UPC militiamen shot and killed 9 civilians in Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou). The civil society asked for the urgent intervention of the military forces to protect the population.
On 21 July 2020, 3R militiamen killed a civilian during an incursion in Lo village, 65 Km from Bocaranga (Ouham Pende). The local residents fled the village towards safer zones.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 21 July 2020, FOCA soldiers (Military Forces) arbitrarily arrested, tortured and jailed 2 men in Paoua (Ouham Pende) following a personal dispute between the military and these men in a night bar the previous week.

column6: PRNC: Party of the Rally of the Central African Nation
column7: Goula Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Former Seleka Militia
column8: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column9: Sara Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Former Seleka Militia
column17: On 21 July 2020, ex-Seleka PRNC armed men, from the Goula ethnic group, clashed with ex-Seleka (FPRC) armed men, from Sara ethnic, near Yangou Yankagna, 45 km north of Ouadda (Haute-Kotto). 2 FPRC combatants were killed and 3 PRNC combatants were injured.

column6: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 22 July 2020, MINUSCA troops (Rwandan battalion) clashed with 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen in Niem town (Bouar, Nana-Mambere) following a military operation by the UN troops. The latter drove the rebels out this town, an important center of cattle production. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: PRNC: Party of the Rally of the Central African Nation
column17: On 22 July 2020, militiamen of the PRNC armed group shot and killed 3 civilians (2 men and 1 woman) in Krakoma village, 100 Km from Ndele (Bamingui-Bangoran). The motive was not reported. This armed group is led by Nourd Gregaza.

column6: PRNC: Party of the Rally of the Central African Nation
column17: On 22 July 2020, suspected armed men of the PRNC armed group shot and killed 2 civilians (Sara ethnicity) at a mining site in Bougnoul Niakania village, 40 Km from Bria (Haute-Kotto). The motive was not reported. This armed group is led by Nourd Gregaza.

column6: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column16: Corbeau News; RFI; AFP; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
column17: On 22 July 2020, MINUSCA troops (Rwandan battalion) clashed with 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen in Gedze, near Niem (Bouar, Nana-Mambere) following a military operation by the UN troops. 3 rebels were killed in the clash. The latter were driven out of the village.

column7: Rounga Ethnic Militia (Central African Republic); FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 23 July 2020, Sara and Rounga ethnic armed men, close to the FPRC militia (former Seleka), shot and killed 1 hunter from the Goula Ethnic in Bornou village, near Boungou 1 (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto). The killing was an ethnic-based reprisal after the killing of a Sara ethnic man the previous day.

column16: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
column17: On 23 July 2020, around 50 armed men from the 3R militia occupied Ngaounday locality (Ngaoundaye, Ouham Pende). These militia combatants were fleeing from military operations by the MINUSCA and the FOCA.

column6: PRNC: Party of the Rally of the Central African Nation
column9: Sara Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Rounga Ethnic Group (Central African Republic)
column17: On 24 July 2020, ethnic Goula militiamen from the PRNC, led by Damane Zackaria, killed at least 10 civilians and injured 20 more during an attack in Bornou village, near Boungou 1 (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto), in which they also destroyed around 50 houses. The attack, mostly against Sara and Rounga people, was reportedly a reprisal for an ethnic-based attack against a Goula hunter the previous day.

column9: Women (Central African Republic); Farmers (Central African Republic)
column17: On 25 July 2020, Anti-Balaka combatants threatened 3 women and looted groundnuts from their fields in Bria (Haute-Kotto).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 25 July 2020, UPC militiamen led by Ali Darassa, intercepted and abducted a convoy of agents of the ANE (National Electoral Commission) in Bokolobo village (Bambari, Ouaka). The agents were on a mission to roll-out the registration of voters for the upcoming election, foreseen for December 2020.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 26 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC armed men tortured 1 man at their base in Ippy (Ouaka). The civil society intervened to secure the release of the victim and MINUSCA forces seized the weapons of 2 assailants.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 26 July 2020, MINUSCA and national military troops clashed with the 3R armed group in Besson (Baboua, Nana-Mambere) in the context of a military operation against the expansion of this rebel group. The state forces drove the militia combatants out and took full control of the town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 27 July 2020, ex-Seleka combatants stole food items during an NGO distribution in Bria (Haute-Kotto).
On 28 July 2020, civilian members of a family attacked and injured an Anti-Balaka combatant in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto) because he had previously attacked a member of this family. [size=no report]

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 28 July 2020, Ex-Seleka UPC armed men looted food and other goods from local people in Bambouti (Bambouti, Haut-Mbomou).
On 28 July 2020, an Anti-Balaka combatant shot and injured 1 civilian man during a dispute in Bria (Haute-Kotto).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 30 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC armed men looted livestock from a community leader in Bambouti (Haut-Mbomou).

column6: PRNC: Party of the Rally of the Central African Nation
column17: On 31 July 2020, PRNC armed men shot and killed 1 local miner in Gbali village, near Ouadda (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto). The attackers also robbed the victim and took his motorbike.

On 31 July 2020, LRA militiamen (Achaye splinter group) abducted 3 men, and 1 young woman and her baby near Koumboli (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou). The attack was in retaliation for 6 children who had escaped from this armed group.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column8: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 31 July 2020, FOCA soldiers clashed with policemen in Bangui-6 (Bangui) following a personal dispute. The exchange of fire resulted in 6 people shot and injured, including 1 civilian.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 31 July 2020, ex-Seleka UPC armed men extorted civilians driving 4 vehicles in Bambouti (Haut-Mbomou). The civilians had to paid money to the militiamen so they could continue on to Obo.

On 1 August 2020, a group of local people beat and seriously injured an elderly man in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The victim, who was accused of witchcraft, died from his injuries later on. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column16: aBangui; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme; Corbeau News
column17: On 2 August 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men led by the self-appointed general Mandayo clashed with FOCA military forces in Grimari (Grimari, Ouaka) following an incursion by these rebels. The Anti-Balaka men, who had intercepted a vehicle with electoral staff and looted some shops, were finally driven off by the military forces. Several militia combatants were killed including the leader Mandayo, and several others were injured. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 2 August 2020, the LRA Achaye abducted a disabled young man at the Biro village, near Zemio (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou).

On 3 August 2020, LRA combatants (Achaye group) assaulted and injured a man in his field, 5 km north of Zemio town (Haut-Mbomou). The assailants asked the man for the location of the children who had escaped from this armed group.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 4 August 2020, UPC armed men abducted a group of ANE (National Election Authority) agents in Bambouti (Bambouti, Haut-Mbomou). The victims, in charge of the voting registration for the upcoming election, were released after the payment of a ransom. Three days later the leader of this armed group signed an agreement with the authorities to support the national election.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column9: Pastoralists (Central African Republic); Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic)
column17: On 4 August 2020, ex-Seleka FPRC armed men abducted 2 Fulani pastoralists in Aigbando (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The Fulani were accused of having rustled livestock.

On 5 August 2020, the UN Security Council voted to impose sanctions on Sidiki Abbas, the leader of the 3R armed group (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation). The group, who withdrew from a peace agreement in June 2020, was accused of killing, torturing, raping and displacing civilians as well as engaging in arms trafficking and in war with other militias since its creation in 2015.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 5 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC combatants tied up and looted a young man 3 km from Karmadar (Rafai, Mbomou), a mining site. Travelers untied the youth after the assailants departed.

column6: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column8: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 6 August 2020, the Central African Republic Prime Minister signed an agreement in Bangui (Banui, Bangui) with the leader of the UPC (Union for Peace in the Central African Republic) armed group, Ali Darass. The latter committed not to hinder the return of state authority as well as the free movement of agents of the ANE (National Election Authority) before the upcoming election. In exchange, among other agreements, this armed group was allowed to return to Bambari (Ouaka), their former headquarters.

On 7 August 2020, Anti-balaka combatants looted 1 Fulani man in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). Local authorities and NGO representatives negotiated with the armed group to secure the return of the stolen item.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 9 August 2020, UPC militiamen led by Ali Darassa reinforced its troops and established its main base in Mboki town (Obo, Haut-Mbomou). They intended to boycott the deployment of voter registration agents from the National Election Authority (ANE).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column8: MLCJ: Movement of Central African Liberators for Justice
column17: On 9 August 2020, FPRC militia combatants (Rounga ethnicity) clashed with MLCJ forces (Goula ethnicity) in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 11 August 2020, unidentified armed men killed (beat to death) an agent of the ANE (National Election Authority) in Ippy (Ouaka). The area is controlled by the ex- Seleka UPC, an armed group which recently signed an agreement with the government to support the election, scheduled for December 2020.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 11 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC armed men intercepted a team of ANE agents (National Election Authority) near Ndjoubissi (Bambari, Ouaka). They robbed them and took all their items for vote registration. This occurred a week after the leader of the armed group had agreed with the government to support the upcoming election.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Presidential Security Unit
column17: On 13 August 2020, soldiers of the Presidential Security Unit shot at 2 civilians during 2 consecutive attacks in Bangui-1 (Bangui). The first victim was unharmed but the second was severely injured. In both attacks the soldiers opened fire at the vehicles because they reportedly committed traffic infractions.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 13 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC combatants looted livestock from herders in Kadjemah locality (Obo, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-); Health Workers (Central African Republic)
column16: Corbeau News; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
column17: On 13 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC militiamen led by Ali Darassa kidnapped 9 civilians near Mboki (Obo, Haut-Mbomou). The victims were 2 agents in charge of the voting registration and 7 health staff working in a vaccination campaign.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 14 August 2020, UPC rebels sabotaged communications in Mboki locality (Obo, Haut-Mbomou) by cutting off the telecom network and the radio in the community.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 14 August 2020, UPC combatants looted 1 hunter 6 km southeast of Obo town (Obo, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 14 August 2020, UPC combatants looted cell phones and knives from 2 young men near Kitessa (Zemio, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 14 August 2020, MINUSCA troops, with aerial support from French military forces, clashed with 3R armed men near Bocaranga (Ouham Pende), following a military operation by the state forces. The rebels, who used heavy weapons, were driven off by the state forces, which destroyed 3 of their bases near this town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 15 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC armed men ambushed and shot dead 1 man (a trader) along the Obo-Bambouti axis, 20 km from Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column16: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
column17: On 15 August 2020, UPC militiamen shot and killed 1 businessman near Obo (Obo, Haut-Mbomou). The motive behind the attack was not reported.
On 15 August 2020, Anti-balaka combatants looted an elderly man in Mbatra village, 12 km north of Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto)
On 16 August 2020, Anti-balaka combatants ambushed an NGO vehicle and robbed the phone of its driver in Bria town (Bria, Haute-Kotto).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 16 August 2020, ex-Seleka UPC men looted food goods from the community in Ligoua-Zewia village (Obo, Haut-Mbomou).

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 17 August 2020, former Seleka UPC combatants tortured and abducted a civil society leader in Mboki (Obo, Haut-Mbomou). They accused the man of sharing information with the state forces.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: On 17 August 2020, MINUSCA and national military forces clashed with 3R armed men in Koui (Koui, Ouham Pende), following a military operation by the state forces. The latter drove these rebels out of the town and fully controlled it. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column16: aBangui; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
column17: Around 19 August 2020 (week of), more than 2,000 people arrived in Bocaranga town (Ouham Pende) from Koui locality. They fled from clashes between the state forces and the 3R armed group.
On 19 August 2020, 1 Anti-balaka combatant attempted to rape an elderly woman abducted in Irabanda (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The civil society secured the release of the woman.

On 19 August 2020, around 20 civil servants from the Office of Youth and Sports gathered in front of the Ministry building in Bangui (Bangui) and blocked the main entries to demand their unpaid wages of the last 4 months. [size=around 20]

Around 19 August 2020 (as reported), the 3R (RRR: Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) armed group led by Abass Sidiki established its main stronghold in the village of Aba (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). This armed group had just been repelled from its former base Koui by state forces.
On 20 August 2020, a group of health workers marched in Bangui (Bangui, Bangui) against the kidnapping of 7 health workers by ex-Seleka UPC militiamen in Haut-Mbomou province. [size=no report]

column6: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
column17: On 21 August 2020, UPC armed men abducted 1 man at Yakoumba mine, in Aigbando 1 (Bria, Haute-Kotto). The man was abducted because he had stabbed another man.

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 22 August 2020, FPRC armed men extorted 2,000 F per person from ANE election agents to register voters in Sam-Ouandja (Ouadda, Haute-Kotto).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 23 August 2020, FPRC armed men tortured a man accused of witchcraft in Aigbando 1 (Bria, Haute-Kotto).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column17: On 24 August 2020, FPRC rebels abducted an elderly man accused of sorcery in Aigbando 1 (Bria, Haute-Kotto).

column6: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
column9: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column17: On 25 August 2020, ex-Seleka FPRC armed men intercepted a team of ANE agents (National Election Authority) in Zacko (Bakouma, Mbomou). They took their vote registration tablets and forced them to leave the area.

column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: Around 26 August 2020 (as reported), FOCA forces together with MINUSCA troops took control of Ngaoundaye area (Ngaoundaye, Ouham Pende) following a military operation against the 3R armed group, which was forced to flee in small groups. The state forces dismantled several bases and assets of this militia.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: Around 26 August 2020 (as reported), FOCA forces together with MINUSCA troops took control of Kounde locality (Baboua, Nana-Mambere) following a military operation against the 3R armed group, which was forced to flee in small groups. The state forces dismantled several bases and assets of this militia.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
column7: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
column17: Around 26 August 2020 (as reported), FOCA forces together with MINUSCA troops took control of Niem-Yelewa area (Bouar, Nana-Mambere) following a military operation against the 3R armed group, which was forced to flee in small groups. The state forces dismantled several bases and assets of this militia.

column6: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
